fixes_reviewed.assessment: Safe - named constant, no behavior change, timeout still enforced correctly

fixes_reviewed.fix: Cache type changed to Dict[str, Dict] keyed by resolved path
fixes_reviewed.assessment: Safe - improves type safety and prevents cache key collisions across different paths
Safe - prevents overly broad partial matches, improves security by limiting match scope
Safe - documentation-only change, no executable code modified

SEC-002.title: Git stderr in error messages may leak internal details
SEC-002.rationale: Internal error handling, not returned to end users. Truncation to 200 chars limits exposure. Hardening opportunity for future sprint.

SEC-003.title: User-controlled data in log f-strings
SEC-003.rationale: Internal logs not exposed to users. No evidence of log injection exploitability. Standard logging practice acceptable for internal services.

security_controls_verified: subprocess timeout still enforced via GIT_TIMEOUT_SECONDS (30s)
cache keyed by resolved path prevents collisions
partial match minimum length (3) prevents single-char matches
all Round 1 controls (allowlist, path validation, secrets redaction) unchanged

summary.recommendation: Approve - all fixes are defensive improvements with no security regressions
